mdJSON Data Dictionary

mdJSON Data Dictionary v2.7.0

mdJSON Data Dictionary

additionalDocumentation Other documents related to, but not defining, the resource such as factsheets, data catalog pages, award documents, proposals, and informational websites.
address Addresses for this contact.
addressee Not defined.
ageReference Citation for works providing detailed information about any element of the geologicAge.
allocation Funds contributed to support the development of the resource.
alternateMetadataReference Reference to alternative metadata for the resource.
associatedResource Other resources which are directly related to the subject resource such as parent, child, or sibling datasets or projects.
attributeGroup Information about groups of attributes describing a coverage.
attributeIdentifier Identifiers for each attribute included in the resource.
attributeReference Reference to a standard or external description of the entity attribute.
attribute Not Defined
authority Citation for the authority issuing the identifier.
bearingDistanceResolution The method of encoding the position of a point by measuring its distance and direction (azimuth angle) from another point.
boundingBox General geographic position of the resource.
citation Citation for the additional resource.
citation Citation for the dictionary.
constraint Provides information about constraints to the use of the resource.
contact Contact information for the maintainer of the resource.
contact An array of contacts to be referenced throughout the metadata.
contact Party from whom the resource may be obtained.
coordinateResolution Not defined.
cornerPoints The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions.
coverageDescription Details about the content of a raster(grid) resource.
crsId Identifies the vertical coordinate reference system used for the minimum and maximum values.
dataDictionary A description of the contents, format and structure of the physical objects in a data resource.
date Date referenced to the cited resource.
datumIdentifier The identification given to the surface taken as the surface of reference from which altitudes or depths are measured.
defaultMetadataLocale Main localised language and characterset used within the metadata record.
defaultResourceLocale Localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the resource.
dimension Information about spatial-temporal axis properties.
distributionFormat Provides information about the format used by the distributor.
distributor Information about the distributor of and options for obtaining the resource.
documentedIssue Citation of a description of known issues associated with the resource along with proposed solutions if available.
domainItem An array of member objects that enumerate and define the valid values for a domain.
domainReference Reference to a standard or list which contains the members of an established set of valid values.
domain A list of permissable values used to constrain an attribute's value.
duration Object for collecting information about a duration or period of time.
ellipsoidIdentifier The identification given to established representations of the Earth's shape.
endGeologicAge A name, code, or date for the end of an event or period in geologic time.
entityReference Reference to a standard or external schema which describes the entity.
entity Defines the structure of a discrete data object within the data resource.
extent Information about the geographic, vertical, and temporal extent of the resource.
features Set of Features constituting the FeatureCollection.
fileConstraint Not Defined
fileUri URI of the graphic.
foreignKey Not Defined
formatSpecification Citation of the specification for the format.
funding Information about funding for the resource.
geodetic Parameters for defining the shape of the earth.
geographicElement An array of objects each describing a geographic boundary or location comprising all or a portion of the resource.
geographicExtent Not defined.
geographicResolution The quantities of latitude and longitude which define the position of a point on the Earth's surface with respect to a reference spheroid.
geologicAge A name, code, or date describing an event or period in geologic time, expressed either as an absolute date calculated using a named dating method, or as a relative date that is drawn from stratigraphy or biostratigraphy.
georectifiedRepresentation A grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e. lat/long) or map coordinate system defined in the SpatialReferencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinates and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation.
georeferenceableRepresentation Grid with cells irregularly spaced in any given geographic/map projection coordinate system, whose individual cells can be geolocated using geolocation information supplied with the data but cannot be geolocated from the grid properties alone.
graphicOverview Provides a path or link to images, maps, flow charts, models, etc.
graphic Not Defined
gridIdentifier The identifier for the grid system.
gridRepresentation Information about grid objects in the resource.
identificationReference Information on any non-authoritative materials (e.g. field guides) useful for reconstructing the actual process.
identifier Identifier for the resource in the context of the citation.
identifier Identifier representing a geographic area.
imageDescription Information about an image's suitability for use.
imageQualityCode Specifies the image quality.
index Not Defined
keyword Array of ISO Topic Category keywords.
legal Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata.
locale Defines the language and country of origin in which the data dictionary is written.
local A description of a local coordinate system.
logoGraphic Logo for contact.
measure Scale of geographic extent expressed in ground distance parameters or angle.
mediumSpecification Not Defined
metadataCitation Citation providing information about the metadata for the source.
metadataCitation Citation for the associated resource metadata.
metadataConstraint Provides information about restrictions on the access and use of metadata.
metadataContact Person or organization responsible for metadata information (metadata custodian).
metadataDate Date that the metadata was updated.
metadataIdentifier Identifier for the metadata.
metadataInfo General information about the metadata record.
metadataMaintenance Provides information about the frequency of metadata updates, and the scope of those updates.
metadataOnlineResource Online location where the metadata is available.
metadataRepository Identifies repositories for distribution of the resource metadata.
metadata The main body of the metadata record.
obliqueLinePoint The method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.
observer Information about the individual(s) responsible for the identification(s) of the specimens or sightings.
offlineOption Information about obtaining the resource through off-line procedure.
onlineOption Information about obtaining the resource on-line.
onlineResource On-line information related to the citation.
orderProcess Provides information about how the resource may be obtained and related instructions and fee information.
otherMetadataLocale Additional localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the metadata record.
otherResourceLocale Alternate localised language(s) and characterset(s) used within the resource.
parameterCitation Reference providing description of the parameters.
parentMetadata Identifier of the metadata to which this metadata is a subset (child).
party Identifies all the contacts associated with the role.
phone Supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the individual or organization.
pointOfContact Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations that may be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource.
processStep A brief statement describing an individual, non-trivial process or methodology step taken in development of the resource data within the data quality scope.
processingLevelCode Code that identifies the level of radiometric and geometric processing that has been applied.
processor Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organization(s) associated with the process or methodology step.
projectionIdentifier The identifier for the projection.
projection The set of parameters for the projection that applies to the resource.
properties JSON object containing information about a feature or collection.
referenceSystemIdentifier The reference system identifier or definition.
referenceSystemParameterSet The set of parameters describing a spatial reference system.
referenceSystem Spatial reference system used by the source.
reference Not Defined
reference Reference to a standard to a standard which contains a definition for the domain item.
releasability Information concerning the parties to who the resource can or cannot be released.
repository Information about the curator or contact person and/or agency responsible for the specimens.
resolution The degree of detail in the grid.
resourceCitation Citation for the associated resource.
resourceDistribution Information about the distributor of and options for obtaining the resource.
resourceFormat Provides a description of the format of the resource.
resourceInfo Information about the resource.
resourceLineage Information on the history of the resource.
resourceMaintenance Information about the maintenance of the resource.
resourceType Identifies the type of resource, such as: userGuide, website, report, etc.
resourceUsage Description of ways in which the resource is currently or has been used.
responsibleParty Not Defined
responsibleParty Name, address, country, and telecommunications address of person or organization having primary responsibility for the intellectual content of this dictionary.
roleExtent The area or period of time for which the role is valid.
schema Identifies the version of the JSON schema standard that applies to the metadata.
scopeDescription Detailed description/listing of the items specified by the scope.
scopeExtent Information about the horizontal, vertical and temporal extent of the resource specified by the scope.
scope Type of resource to which the maintenance information applies.
scope temporal extent and or level of the application of the constraint restrictions.
security Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.
series Information about the series, or aggregate resource, to which a resource belongs.
sourceCitation A citation providing information about the source dataset, including an online resource or other access instructions.
sourceProcessStep A description of a non-trivial event or transformation taken to prepare the source data for use in creating the data identified by the data quality scope.
source Information about the source data used in creating the data identified by the data quality scope.
spatialReferenceSystem Geospatial referencing system used in the the data resource. The reference can be provided by an EPSG number, a named reference, or providing the parameters in a well known text (WKT) format.
spatialRepresentation Method used to spatially represent geographic information.
spatialResolution Not Defined
spatialResolution Information about the scale of the geographic extent.
startGeologicAge A name, code, or date for the beginning of an event or period in geologic time.
stepProduct Information about an intermediate data set that (1) is significant in the opinion of the data producer, (2) is generated in the processing step, and (3) is used in later processing steps.
stepSource Information about the source data used in the process step.
subClassification Not defined.
taxonomicClassification Not defined.
taxonomicSystem Information about the taxonomic classification system used.
taxonomy Information on the taxa (1 or more) included in the data set, including keywords, taxonomic system and coverage information, and taxonomic classification system.
temporalExtent An array of objects each describing a temporal boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.
temporalResolution Information about the termporal period of the resource.
thesaurus Name of the formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of keywords.
timeInstant Represents an identifiable position in time.
timeInterval Defines a length of time in specific units.
timePeriod The earliest or only date for which the attribute values are current.
timePeriod A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.
transferFrequency The rate of occurrence of distribution.
transferOption Describes method and media by which a resource is obtained from the distributor.
userContactInfo Identification of the persons and/or organizations that are using the resource.
valueRange The minimum and maximum values that may be assigned to the attribute.
vectorObject Not Defined
vectorRepresentation Not Defined
verticalDatum The reference frame or system from which vertical distances (altitudes or depths) are measured.
verticalExtent An array of objects each describing a vertical boundary comprising all or a portion of the resource.
voucher Information on the types of specimen, the repository, and the individuals who identified the vouchers.

                                                                                                cornerPoints top

                                                                                                Name Type Description Required Translation Viewer Link
                                                                                                cornerPoints ambiguous The earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. Note: There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required. The first corner point corresponds to the origin of the grid.
